data.text: The usual past form is sneaked , but snuck is now very common in informal speech in
and some people use it in
too. However, many people think that it is not correct and it should not be used in formal writing.
过去式通常为sneaked，但在北美英语非正式的口语中，现在snuck用得很普遍，在英国英语中也有人使用。不过，许多人认为不正确，不应在正式书面语中使用。

data.enText: to go somewhere secretly, trying to avoid being seen
to do sth or take sb/sth somewhere secretly, often without permission

data.chText: 我们偷偷看了一眼她的日记。
data.enText: We sneaked a look at her diary.

data.chText: 我设法偷偷给他递了张条子。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: I managed to sneak a note to him.

data.chText: 我设法偷偷给他递了张条子。
data.enText: I managed to sneak him a note.

data.chText: 偷走（不重要的或小的东西）
data.enText: to secretly take sth small or unimportant

data.chText: 趁他们不在屋里，我偷偷拿了一块蛋糕。
data.enText: I sneaked a cake when they were out of the room.
to tell an adult that another child has done sth wrong, especially in order to cause trouble

data.chText: 你有没有向老师告我的状？
data.enText: Did you sneak on me to the teacher?
to move towards sb very quietly so that they do not see or hear you until you reach them

data.chText: 他偷偷溜到妹妹身边，然后大喊一声“嘿！”
data.enText: He sneaked up on his sister and shouted ‘Boo!’.

data.chText: 打小报告的人，告状者（尤指儿童）
data.enText: a person, especially a child, who tells sb about sth wrong that another person has done

means: 偷走(不重要的或小的东西)
打小报告的人，告状者(尤指儿童)

data.enText: to move towards sb very quietly so that they do not see or hear you until you reach them

data.chText: 他偷偷溜到妹妹身边，然后大喊一声“嘿！”
data.enText: He sneaked up on his sister and shouted ‘Boo!’.

trans: 突然降临；出其不意地发生

tr: someone acting as an informer or decoy for the police
someone who prowls or sneaks about
a person who is regarded as underhanded and furtive and contemptible

example: ..stead of sneaking around spying on the neighbor's house
He slipped me the key when nobody was looking

tr: make off with belongings of others
put, bring, or take in a secretive or furtive manner

value.boxr_value: The form snuck is also used in American English for the past tense and past participle. 在美国英语里 snuck 也用作过去式和过去分词。

value.def: If you sneak somewhere, you go there very quietly on foot, trying to avoid being seen or heard.

example.ex: Sometimes he would sneak out of his house late at night to be with me...
example.tran: 有时候，他会在深夜里偷偷溜出家与我相会。

value.def: If you sneak something somewhere, you take it there secretly.

example.ex: He smuggled papers out each day, photocopied them, and snuck them back...
example.tran: 他每天都把文件偷偷地带出去复印，然后再偷偷地拿回来。

example.ex: You even snuck me a cigarette.
example.tran: 你居然偷偷塞给我一支烟。

value.def: If you sneak a look at someone or something, you secretly have a quick look at them.

example.ex: You sneak a look at your watch to see how long you've got to wait.
example.tran: 你偷偷地望一眼手表，看看要等多长时间。
